intro: Lomelosia epirota, commonly known as the Epirus lomelosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Greece. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the flora of the Balkan Peninsula.
